newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - March 28.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - March 28.

text.p: These are significant items in the Ivorian press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these items and does not vouch for their accuracy. FRATERNITE MATIN - NGO forest conservation group "SOS Forets" aims to galvanise action to prevent further destruction of forests and loss of biodiversity, starting with renovation of Bingerville botanical garden which has lost all but 79 of its original 800 species. - Fire, electricity and access route safety standards at Abidjan's bustling street markets need attention say inspectors. Fire destroyed one of the largest, Treichville, in March. - Armed robbers attack Abidjan coffee warehouse before police chase. Elsewhere, armed robbers hold up restaurant clients. LA VOIE - Tourist-pulling three day traditional mask dance ceremony, named "Gueheva Festival", opens in Man in northwest Ivory Coast. - France donates 10 tonnes of medical and surgical equipment for Ivorian medical units in Liberia as part of West African peacekeeping force ECOMOG. LE JOUR - Book fair needed in Abidjan as a step to ensure more works by African authors get into print and are marketed in Africa, rather than just Europe, at prices affordable for Africans, says local editor returning from Paris book salon. - Students union FESCI continues stand-off with government over grants and other grievances with sit-in at Cocody University -- Abidjan newsroom +225 21 90 90 ABI MPB NK
